SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client

Interface LDAPConnected

All Known Implementing Classes:
LDAPClientConnection
public interface LDAPConnected
Operations available after LDAP connection is established.

This interface is provided to the handler in LDAPConnectionReady.handleReady(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client.LDAPConnected) after the TCP connection (and TLS handshake for LDAPS) is complete.

Unlike SMTP which has a server greeting, LDAP clients initiate the conversation. At this stage, the handler should typically:

  • Bind with credentials using bind()
  • Bind anonymously using bindAnonymous()
  • Upgrade to TLS using startTLS() (for non-LDAPS connections)

Most LDAP operations require a successful bind first. After binding, the handler receives an LDAPSession interface for performing directory operations.

Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:
  • LDAPConnectionReady.handleReady(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client.LDAPConnected)
  • LDAPSession

  • Method Details

    • bind

      void bind(String dn, String password, BindResultHandler callback)
      Performs a simple bind (authentication) with DN and password.

      This is the standard authentication method for LDAP. After a successful bind, the handler receives an LDAPSession for performing directory operations.

      Parameters:
      dn - the distinguished name to bind as (e.g., "cn=admin,dc=example,dc=com")
      password - the password for authentication
      callback - receives the bind result

    • bindAnonymous

      void bindAnonymous(BindResultHandler callback)
      Performs an anonymous bind.

      Anonymous binds use empty DN and password. Some servers allow limited operations (typically read-only searches) for anonymous connections.

      Parameters:
      callback - receives the bind result

    • startTLS

      void startTLS(StartTLSResultHandler callback)
      Initiates a STARTTLS upgrade to encrypt the connection.

      This should be called before binding to protect credentials. The LDAPClient must have been configured with an SSLContext before connecting.

      After successful TLS upgrade, the handler receives an LDAPPostTLS interface and should proceed to bind.

      Parameters:
      callback - receives the STARTTLS result

    • unbind

      void unbind()
      Closes the connection without binding.

      Sends an unbind request and closes the connection. This is appropriate when the handler decides not to proceed with the connection (e.g., TLS not available when required).
